articles.author: Simon Leo Brown, Marc Fennell
articles.title: The Motonui epa were taken from New Zealand. It took decades of legal fighting to bring them home - ABC News
articles.description: For more than a century, the sacred treasure was hidden in a New Zealand swamp. Then it was sold off and spirited away to Europe. This is how it was returned.
articles.content:
The history of the Motunui epa has included wars, smuggling, a kidnapping and a high-profile court case. (Supplied: Robin Martin)

articles.title: Europe's veteran gamma-ray space telescope nearly killed by charged particle strike - Space.com
articles.description: "We were immensely relieved to get the spacecraft out of this 'near-death' experience," an ESA official said.
articles.content:
The European Space Agency (ESA) nearly lost a veteran space telescope last month when a charged particle disabled one of the reaction wheels that keep its solar arrays pointed at the sun.

articles.title: Europe's Apollo-13 moment: When a 19-year-long space mission escaped death - India Today
articles.description: An anomaly triggered the European spacecraft to lose control and begin spinning on its axis.

articles.author: Bloomberg News
articles.title: Russia Signals Europe Won't Get Extra Gas Without Nord Stream 2 - BNN
articles.description: Russia is signaling that it won’t go out of its way to offer European consumers extra gas to ease the current energy crisis unless it gets something in return: regulatory approval to start shipments through the controversial Nord Stream 2 pipeline.

articles.title: Brussels hints talks won’t include stripping EU judges from Northern Ireland Protocol - TheJournal.ie
articles.description: The EU said a ‘very intense period of discussions’ has begun but suggested they may not include the role of the European Court of Justice.
articles.content:
